title: Bon Clay's Future Return as 10th Straw Hat
theory: Bon Clay has been absent from the main storyline for 15 years since his sacrifice in Impel Down. A fan theory suggests that Eiichiro Oda is intentionally keeping Bon Clay's return low-key to ensure his comeback will be grand and impactful, potentially as the 10th member of the Straw Hat Pirates. The theory argues that Bon Clay's unwavering friendship, loyalty, and sacrifices for Luffy make him one of the most deserving characters to join the crew.
author: Various One Piece fans
evidence: Bon Clay has demonstrated extreme loyalty to Luffy multiple times, including his ten-hour vigil in episode 440
He made ultimate sacrifices in both Alabasta and Impel Down arcs
Luffy considers him a true friend and calls him 'Bon-Chan'
Cover story confirms he's still alive as Queen of Newkama Land
His absence from the story for 15 years could be building toward a major return
counterEvidence: Bon Clay's role as Queen of Newkama Land gives him important responsibilities
Oda has stated the crew won't grow much larger
Bon Clay's character arc may be complete as is

source.title: One Piece Theory: It's Been 15 Years Since Bon Clay's Last Appearance

title: Bon Clay's Survival Against Magellan
theory: After episode 451, many fans theorized about how Bon Clay survived his confrontation with Magellan, the warden with deadly poison powers. The mystery remained until Chapter 666's cover story revealed he was alive as Queen of Newkama Land. Theories include: (1) He used his Mane Mane no Mi powers to impersonate Magellan or another official to escape, (2) He was rescued by remaining Newkama residents, (3) Magellan chose not to kill him out of respect for his loyalty, or (4) He developed immunity to Magellan's poison through repeated exposure.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Chapter 666 cover story confirms Bon Clay is alive
He has shown incredible durability and willpower throughout the series
His Devil Fruit allows for deception and impersonation
The Newkama Land residents could have rescued him
counterEvidence: Magellan's poison is shown to be almost always fatal
The cover story doesn't explain HOW he survived

source.title: One Piece: Is Bon Clay still alive? The character's fate after Impel Down arc, explained

title: Morley Created New Kama Land Over 100 Years Ago
theory: When episode 440 first aired, the identity of the 'prisoner with tunneling abilities' who created New Kama Land was unknown, leading to fan speculation. Later revealed in the Reverie Arc, Morley of the Revolutionary Army was confirmed to be the creator. The theory suggests Morley was imprisoned in Impel Down over 100 years ago, used the Oshi Oshi no Mi (Push-Push Fruit) to create the hidden sanctuary between Level 5 and 6, and then escaped. This theory was later confirmed to be canon.
author: One Piece Fan Community (Later confirmed by Oda)
evidence: Morley has the Oshi Oshi no Mi that allows ground manipulation
Morley is revealed to be over 100 years old
Morley has connections to the Revolutionary Army like Ivankov
The tunnels match the description of Morley's Devil Fruit abilities

source.title: Oda revealed Who created Newkama Land in Impel Down

title: Luffy's Willpower Created the 'Miracle'
theory: The episode's title 'Believe in Miracles' and Luffy's impossible recovery in less than a day instead of three days led fans to theorize that it wasn't just Ivankov's healing hormones that saved Luffy, but his incredible willpower and the collective belief/cheering of Bon Clay and the Newkama residents. Some fans suggest this demonstrates an early example of Conqueror's Haki or willpower affecting physical reality, similar to later reveals about Haki. The theory proposes that belief and willpower in One Piece can literally manifest miracles.
author: One Piece Theory Community
evidence: Ivankov explicitly states the treatment should take 3 days minimum
Luffy recovered in less than a day
The collective cheering happened right before his recovery
Similar 'willpower miracles' occur throughout the series
Luffy's later feats show his willpower can overcome impossible odds
counterEvidence: Ivankov's hormones are established as the medical explanation
No explicit Haki usage is shown
It could simply be Luffy's natural recovery ability
